snippet: After seven years of litigation, Google and book publishers reached a settlement that would allow the publishers to choose whether Google digitizes their books and journals, and to share revenue if the works are purchased through Google's online...
abstract: After seven years of litigation, Google and book publishers reached a settlement that would allow the publishers to choose whether Google digitizes their books and journals, and to share revenue if the works are purchased through Google's online store, reports Claire Cain Miller in Friday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Google Deal Gives Publishers a Choice to Digitize or Not
